headline: How to Invest $10,000
Amazon bullies partners and vendors, says antitrust subcommittee
summary: The House Judiciary subcommittee on antitrust said in a Tuesday report that Amazon's retail dominance gives it monopoly power over third-party sellers.

headline: Google 'overwhelmingly' dominates search market, antitrust committee states
summary: Google 'overwhelmingly' dominates search market, antitrust committee states

headline: As long-term Treasury yields rise, investor Peter Boockvar warns inflation would spark the 'market's worst nightmare'
summary: Bleakley Advisory Group’s Peter Boockvar believes Wall Street is on the cusp of taking inflation more seriously.
"We've been able to thwart a number of attacks, but we see everything is going very smoothly," Cloudflare CEO Matthew Prince told CNBC's Jim Cramer.
headline: Cloudflare CEO: Dozens of U.S. states are using Athenian Project for election security

summary: The House Judiciary antitrust subcommittee determined Facebook wields monopoly powers in social network and has maintained its position by acquiring, copying or killing its competitors, according to a report released by the subcommittee on Tuesday.
headline: Facebook is a social network monopoly that buys, copies or kills competitors, antitrust committee finds
Jim Cramer reveals a list of stocks worth buying after Trump shut down stimulus talks
summary: "Without [a stimulus package], numbers will have to come down for a whole host of companies, but not technology," the "Mad Money" host said.

headline: Rick Bright, Trump administration vaccine expert turned whistleblower, resigns NIH post
summary: Rick Bright, the Trump administration vaccine expert turned whistleblower, resigned from the federal government Tuesday, according to a press release from his lawyer.

The 450-page report from the Democratic majority staff of the House Judiciary Committee focuses on Apple's control of its App Store, the only way for consumers to install apps or software on an iPhone, along with Apple's proclivity to buy smaller technology companies and turn them into features for Apple products.
headline: Apple's 'monopoly power' over iPhone app distribution gives it outsized profits, Democrats say

summary: Stocks fell on Tuesday after President Trump tweeted the White House would halt talks with Democrats about a second coronavirus stimulus deal.
headline: Stocks set to fall a second day after Trump halts stimulus talks, Dow futures fall 130 points
Trump's ending of stimulus talks will mean a 'much slower' recovery, Fed's Mester says
summary: "It's going to be a much slower recovery and it's disappointing that we didn't get a package done," Mester told CNBC.

headline: HHS threatens to withhold federal funding from hospitals that fail to report coronavirus data
Rock legend Eddie Van Halen has died after long battle with throat cancer
summary: Eddie Van Halen, guitarist and co-founder of Van Halen, has died after a long battle with throat cancer. He was 65.

headline: TikTok passes Instagram as second-most popular social app for U.S. teens
summary: TikTok has surpassed Instagram as teenagers' second favorite social media app, according to a report published on Tuesday.

headline: Boeing, airline stocks tumble after Trump calls off pandemic stimulus talks until after election
summary: Aviation-related stocks tumbled after Trump called off stimulus talks until after the Nov. 3 election.

headline: Facebook revenue chief says ad-supported model is ‘under assault’ amid Apple privacy changes
summary: The change to Apple's identifier for advertisers, or IDFA,will give iPhone users the option to block tracking when opening an app. Facebook calls it a threat to the ad-supported business model that's helped the internet grow.

headline: Supreme Court opens politically charged term with major business cases involving Google, Oracle and Ford
summary: Google, Oracle and Ford are at the Supreme Court in disputes expected to have broad impacts on American businesses and consumers.

headline: Watch live: Fauci, Slaoui, Bloomberg and Collins participate in coronavirus vaccine symposium
summary: Johns Hopkins University and the University of Washington are holding a series of panels on Tuesday with the nation's top health officials as part of a Covid-19 vaccine symposium.
Apple announced the new Apple Watch Series 6, iPad Air and 8th-generation iPad during an event in September but the iPhone was absent.
headline: Apple announces Oct. 13 event where it's expected to reveal new iPhones

summary: Most voters do not believe the U.S. will quickly rebound from the recession caused by the effects of coronavirus pandemic. About 65% of registered voters expect the U.S. economy to take more than a year to fully recover.
headline: 65% of voters believe it will take over a year for the economy to recover
